snippet: Several top officials in the government say a ruling committee might be best for now as the candidates in Afghanistan’s recent presidential vote dispute the results.
abstract: Group of powerful Afghan government ministers and officials with strong ties to security forces are threatening to seize power if election impasse between Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani is not resolved soon; officials stress that they hope threat of forming interim government would persuade the rival presidential candidates to compromise.
lead_paragraph: Several top officials in the government say a ruling committee might be best for now as the candidates in Afghanistan’s recent presidential vote dispute the results.

headline.main: Amid Election Impasse, Calls in Afghanistan for an Interim Government
headline.print_headline: Amid Election Impasse, Calls in Afghanistan for an Interim Government
